feed.title: VictoriaMetrics Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for VictoriaMetrics: v1.102.8
entry.content:
v1.102.8

Released at 2024-11-29

v1.102.x is a line of LTS releases. It contains important up-to-date bugfixes for VictoriaMetrics enterprise. All these fixes are also included in the latest community release. The v1.102.x line will be supported for at least 12 months since v1.102.0 release

  • BUGFIX: vmagent: properly parse multitenant token value for multitenant endpoints. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmagent: Properly return 200 OK HTTP status code when importing data via Pushgateway protocol using multitenant URL format. See this issue and this pull request.
  • BUGFIX: vmagent: Properly set TCP connection timeout for Kubernetes API server connection for metric scrapping with kubernetes_sd_configs. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmagent: fix the resource_group filter for Azure service discovery on virtual machine scale sets. Previously, this filter did not apply to virtual machine scale sets, causing all virtual machines to be discovered. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmauth: properly init ip_filters for unauthorized_user config section. Previously it was ignored and vmauth didn't apply ip_filter for unauthorized access.
  • BUGFIX: vmsingle, vmselect in VictoriaMetrics cluster: properly return result for binary operation ^ aka pow at query requests for NaN values. See this issue for details.
  • BUGFIX: vmui: fix for showLegend and alias flags in predefined panels. See this issue

entry.title: New release for VictoriaMetrics: v1.108.0
entry.content:
v1.108.0

Released at 2024-12-13

Update note 1: meaning of -maxLabelsPerTimeseries and -maxLabelValueLen has been changed. Previously, excessive labels, label names and values were truncated and could result in silent data collision. With the new change time series that are hitting the limits will be dropped instead.

Update note 2: docker_sd_configs now by default matches only first network if the container has multiple networks defined. This change aligns with Prometheus SD behavior. Please see this issue if you need to match multiple networks.

  • SECURITY: upgrade Go builder from Go1.23.3 to Go1.23.4. See the list of issues addressed in Go1.23.4.

  • SECURITY: upgrade base docker image (Alpine) from 3.20.3 to 3.21.0. See alpine 3.21.0 release notes.

  • FEATURE: Single-node VictoriaMetrics and vminsert in VictoriaMetrics cluster: changes behaviour of meaning of -maxLabelsPerTimeseries and -maxLabelValueLen flag limits, time series that are hitting the limits will be dropped. And removes corresponding metrics vm_too_long_label_values_total, vm_too_long_label_names_total, vm_metrics_with_dropped_labels_total. See this issue.

  • FEATURE: vmagent: support -maxLabelsPerTimeseries, -maxLabelNameLen and -maxLabelValueLen flags to limit amount of labels, label name and value length for pushed or scraped series. See this issue.
  • FEATURE: Single-node VictoriaMetrics, vminsert in VictoriaMetrics cluster and vmagent: adds new values [too_many_labels,too_long_label_name,too_long_label_value] to reason label of the vm_rows_ignored_total exposed metric name. See this issue.
  • FEATURE: vmagent and Single-node VictoriaMetrics: add match_first_network support for docker service discovery. It uses the first network if the container has multiple networks defined. See this issue.
  • FEATURE: vmagent and Single-node VictoriaMetrics: Docker service discovery now supports containers discovery via linked networks. See this PR for details.
  • FEATURE: dashboards: add NodeBecomesReadonlyIn3Days alert for detecting storages that will switch to read-only mode soon.
  • FEATURE: vmauth: allow to start vmauth with empty configuration file. See this issue for details.
  • FEATURE: vmalert-tool: support debug mode for alerting rule. See this doc.

  • FEATURE: vmui: update error messages for Clipboard API issues with docs links. See this issue.

  • BUGFIX: all VictoriaMetrics components: consistently deduplicate values with stale markers within deduplication interval. Previously, deduplication could randomly prefer stale marker or value on the deduplication interval. See this issue for details. Thanks to @tIGO for the pull request.

  • BUGFIX: vmagent and Single-node VictoriaMetrics: add missing common service labels for docker swarm service discovery when role is set to tasks. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmalert: properly template rule annotations and labels with define and block template functions. See this PR for details.
  • BUGFIX: vmalert: properly reload external templates defined with -rule.templates. Previously externalURL function worked incorrectly. See this PR for details.
  • BUGFIX: vmauth: fix requests routing by host when using src_hosts. Previously, request header could be ignored.See this PR for details.
  • BUGFIX: vmbackupmanager: prevent backup scheduler from scheduling two backups immediately one after another.
  • BUGFIX: Single-node VictoriaMetrics and vmselect in VictoriaMetrics cluster: properly parse the query rollup window specified in milliseconds. Previous implementation could lead to precision issues resulting in the parsed window being smaller by 1ms. See this issue for details.
  • BUGFIX: Single-node VictoriaMetrics and vmstorage in VictoriaMetrics cluster: properly schedule historical data de-duplication at enterprise version with -dedup.minScrapeInterval configured. See this issue for details. Issue was introduced at v1.106.1 release.
  • BUGFIX: vmui: prevent accordion from collapsing when selecting text in headers. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmui: fix query interval display in the instant query info. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmselect in VictoriaMetrics cluster: respect -search.skipSlowReplicas when -globalReplicationFactor > 1. See this issue.

entry.title: New release for VictoriaMetrics: v1.97.14
entry.content:
v1.97.14

Released at 2024-12-13

v1.97.x is a line of LTS releases. It contains important up-to-date bugfixes for VictoriaMetrics enterprise. All these fixes are also included in the latest community release. The v1.97.x line will be supported for at least 12 months since v1.97.0 release

  • SECURITY: upgrade base docker image (Alpine) from 3.20.3 to 3.21.0. See alpine 3.21.0 release notes.

  • SECURITY: upgrade Go builder from Go1.23.3 to Go1.23.4. See the list of issues addressed in Go1.23.4.

  • BUGFIX: all VictoriaMetrics components: consistently deduplicate values with stale markers within deduplication interval. Previously, deduplication could randomly prefer stale marker or value on the deduplication interval. See this issue for details. Thanks to @tIGO for the pull request.

  • BUGFIX: vmsingle, vmselect in VictoriaMetrics cluster: properly parse the query rolloup window specified in milliseconds. Previous implementation could lead to precision issues resulting in the parsed window being smaller by 1ms. See this issue for details.
  • BUGFIX: vmauth: fix requests routing by host when using src_hosts. Previously, request header could be ignored.
  • BUGFIX: vmbackupmanager: prevent backup scheduler from scheduling two backups immediately one after another.
  • BUGFIX: vmui: prevent accordion from collapsing when selecting text in headers. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmui: fix query interval display in the instant query info. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmagent and Single-node VictoriaMetrics: add missing common service labels for docker swarm service discovery when role is set to tasks. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmalert: fix possible template collision between rule annotations.

entry.title: New release for VictoriaMetrics: v1.102.9
entry.content:
v1.102.9

Released at 2024-12-13

v1.102.x is a line of LTS releases. It contains important up-to-date bugfixes for VictoriaMetrics enterprise. All these fixes are also included in the latest community release. The v1.102.x line will be supported for at least 12 months since v1.102.0 release

  • SECURITY: upgrade base docker image (Alpine) from 3.20.3 to 3.21.0. See alpine 3.21.0 release notes.

  • SECURITY: upgrade Go builder from Go1.23.3 to Go1.23.4. See the list of issues addressed in Go1.23.4.

  • BUGFIX: all VictoriaMetrics components: consistently deduplicate values with stale markers within deduplication interval. Previously, deduplication could randomly prefer stale marker or value on the deduplication interval. See this issue for details. Thanks to @tIGO for the pull request.

  • BUGFIX: vmsingle, vmselect in VictoriaMetrics cluster: properly parse the query rollup window specified in milliseconds. Previous implementation could lead to precision issues resulting in the parsed window being smaller by 1ms. See this issue for details.
  • BUGFIX: vmauth: fix requests routing by host when using src_hosts. Previously, request header could be ignored.
  • BUGFIX: vmbackupmanager: prevent backup scheduler from scheduling two backups immediately one after another.
  • BUGFIX: vmui: prevent accordion from collapsing when selecting text in headers. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmui: fix query interval display in the instant query info. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmagent and Single-node VictoriaMetrics: add missing common service labels for docker swarm service discovery when role is set to tasks. See this issue.
  • BUGFIX: vmalert: fix possible template collision between rule annotations.
  • BUGFIX: vmalert: fix externalURL function in -rule.templates after config reload.
  • BUGFIX: vmselect in VictoriaMetrics cluster: respect -search.skipSlowReplicas when -globalReplicationFactor > 1. See this issue.

entry.title: New release for VictoriaMetrics: v1.108.1
entry.content:
v1.108.1

Released at 2024-12-18

  • BUGFIX: vmsingle properly apply -relabelConfig rules for data ingestion protocols. Issue was introduced at v1.108.0 and only affects vmsingle. release. See this issue for details.
  • BUGFIX: vmsingle, vmselect in VictoriaMetrics cluster: make instant query results consistent. VictoriaMetrics detects and adjusts scrape interval and while this is very useful for range queries (i.e. this eliminates gaps on the graph), it may cause instant queries to return a non-empty result when no result is expected. The fix is to disable scrape interval detection and always use the step as the scrape interval in instant queries. This will guarantee that the samples are searched within the (time-step, time] interval. See this issue for details.
  • BUGFIX: vmui: fix cursor reset in query input field. See this issue.
